flavorText: Synchronized spell weaving is a difficult but rewarding skill to master.

foreignData.flavorText: 同期呪文織りは困難な技だが、修得すれば見返りは大きい。
foreignData.name: 呪文織りのデュオ
foreignData.text:
助力（他のプレイヤー１人が、この呪文のコストを最大{6}支払うことができる。）
呪文織りのデュオが戦場に出たとき、タップ状態のクリーチャー１体を対象とする。あなたはそれをオーナーの手札に戻してもよい。
foreignData.type: クリーチャー — 人間・ウィザード

foreignData.flavorText: 熟练掌握同步织咒这项技艺十分困难，但回报颇丰。
foreignData.name: 织咒搭档
foreignData.text:
助力（另一位牌手能够为此咒语的费用支付至多{6}。）
当织咒搭档进战场时，你可以将目标已横置的生物移回其拥有者手上。

name: Spellweaver Duo
originalText:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {6} of this spell's cost.)
When Spellweaver Duo enters the battlefield, you may return target tapped creature to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You may reveal a card with assist and discuss how to pay for it before you begin to cast the spell. Targets are chosen for that spell before you choose another player to help you pay for it and before that player has committed any mana to doing so.
Only the generic mana portion of a spell’s cost can be paid with assist. Any colored mana costs must be paid by the spell’s controller, even if the assisting player paid mana of that color.

If an effect allows a player to cast a spell spending mana “as though it were mana of any color” or “of any type,” that player must still pay for the colored mana in that spell’s total cost. That cost doesn’t become generic.

Assist allows another player to pay for any amount of generic mana. If an effect changes the cost of the spell, the amount that player may pay will be more or less than the amount in the spell’s reminder text.

text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {6} of this spell's cost.)
When Spellweaver Duo enters the battlefield, you may return target tapped creature to its owner's hand.
